titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brady Gallery collection, 1860-1980 RG0146
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-08 15:41:40 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

physdesc.extent: 37 oversize folders 1 box (unidentified size) 1 slim letter document box 1 medium flat-box

did.abstract: Collection includes 75 photographs and architectural drawings and paintings. The dates range from about 1800 to about 2010.
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: Photographs; Architectural drawings and paintings. Separated by size. Oversize folders are in map case drawers, other smaller items are in Boxes 1-3. Within the boxes, items are organized by the original photograph #1, therby preserving the order orginally entered into the finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection include photographs, paintings, and drawings of students, faculty, staff, trustees, and campus buildings. They range in date from 1860 to 1980, and were transferred to the University Archives by the Luther W. Brady Art Gallery.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Luther W. Brady Art Gallery, 11/6/2013 [2013.038]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Some audiovisual materials in Series 4 may be inaccessible.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Two images: graduating classes of 1868 and 1869 were removed from the collection due to excessive damage. Both images did provide identification of the people in the images. From original archival object: Class of 1868: Names printed on mat: Mortimer Clarke, Leonidas Crendiropuls, John T. Beckley, James Pollard, Charles E. Samson, Lingham B. Allen, Joseph E. Martin, Joseph H. France, Rev. George W. Samson, D.D., LL.D. (President), Sidney W. Handy, Francis C. Bowen, William V. Bouic Jr.

Class of 1869 Names printed on mat: (back row): George Y. Coffin, Samuel S. Pleasants, Francis R. Boston, Zachariah T. Sowers, Lester F. Ward, Alexander T. Stuart, Fabian Franklin (front row): William H. Finckle, Franklin H. Kerfoot, John W. Bidgood, Rev. George W. Samson, D.D., LL.D. (President), Edward O. Leech, Edward C. Carrington, Jr.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Luther W. Brady Art Gallery, an educational gallery located on the second floor of the Media and Public Affairs Building, is the professional showcase for art at George Washington University. Opened in March of 2001, the Brady gallery features six to eight exhibitions each year and include University-related shows and Permanent Collection exhibitions with a focus on the Washington area. The gallery also administers the University's Permanent Collection, which includes paintings, sculptures, graphics, textiles, ceramics, historic furnishings, and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains 66 photographs of university-affiliated persons (students, staff, faculty, trustees). The material dates from about 1868 to about 1948.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Back of photograph mat implies that the photograph was obtained by Mrs. Daniel Kerfoot Shute. It reads:
Shute Oct. 12, 1905
Doctor & Mrs. Shute Mrs. D. K. Shute 1719 De Sales Frame 50 47 Mat 15 65 Chq Fit 10 75 1460

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains 9 architectural drawings/paintings of various campus buildings. The material dates from about 1970 to about 1988.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains exhibit publications dating from 2006-2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series include CDs containing information, photographs, and videos of various components of the Brady Galley's work. There are CDs that deal with adminitrative matters, such as artist bios and loan documents. There are also CDs related to exhibitions, such as "Richard Avedon: Portraits of Power" in 2009 and "Sargent and the Sea" in 2009. And, some CDs provide information about events, such as the New Student Reception and Grad Open House.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The CDs in this series may be inaccessible.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series include CDs containing information, photographs, and videos of various components of the Brady Galley's work. There are CDs that deal with adminitrative matters, such as artist bios and loan documents. There are also CDs related to exhibitions, such as "Richard Avedon: Portraits of Power" in 2009 and "Sargent and the Sea" in 2009. And, some CDs provide information about events, such as the New Student Reception and Grad Open House.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: A decision was made not to catalog this series in full. If you are interested in learning more about the CDs in this file, please contact Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series include diplomas, programs, champagne glasses from the Brady Gallery. The materials range in date from about 1800 to about 2010
